intro: Ficus ceronii, commonly known as the Cerón fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the Caribbean islands, particularly Cuba and Hispaniola. The plant is characterized by its glossy, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Ficus ceronii typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, tropical environments. Its fruit, a small fig, is edible and has been used in traditional medicine.
